item.title: 特朗普的木材关税来了。谁受到的冲击最大
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统宣布对进口木材和木制品全面征收关税，他的政府称这是保护美国经济和促进国内制造业发展的需要。从 10 月 14 日起，软木木材将面临 10% 的关税，而厨柜、浴室柜和其他木制成品将被征收 25% 的关税，并在 1 月份进一步提高。【原文：President Donald Trump unveiled sweeping tariffs on imported lumber and wood products that his administration says are needed to protect the US economy and boost domestic manufacturing. As of Oct. 14, softwood lumber faces 10% duties, while kitchen cabinets, bathroom vanities, and other finished wood goods are subject to 25% tariffs that rise further in January.】

item.title: Spotify 将开始在 Netflix 上播放视频播客
item.description:
Spotify Studios 和 Ringer 的某些节目（包括 Bill Simmons 的播客）将于明年开始同时在这两项服务上发布

。【原文：

Certain shows from Spotify Studios and the Ringer, including Bill Simmons’ podcast, will begin publishing simultaneously on both services next year

】

item.title: 美国制裁从美国受害者手中窃取数十亿美元的网络骗子
item.description: 特朗普政府制裁了东南亚一百多家与在线投资骗局有关的公司和个人，这些骗局近年来骗取了美国受害者数十亿美元。【原文：The Trump administration sanctioned more than a hundred companies and individuals in Southeast Asia linked to online investment scams that have fleeced US victims of billions of dollars in recent years.】

item.title: 米莱团队在特朗普会晤前发出混合外汇政策信号
item.description: 阿根廷总统哈维尔-米莱伊（Javier Milei）的放松管制沙皇表示，随着阿根廷目前的贸易范围扩大，阿根廷将 "很快 "实行浮动汇率。【原文：Argentina will have a floating exchange rate “pretty soon” as its current trading band widens, according to President Javier Milei’s deregulation czar.】

item.title: 自由港将摆脱数十年来设定的铜基准
item.description: 自由港麦克莫兰公司（Freeport McMoRan Inc.【原文：Freeport McMoRan Inc. plans to break away from the benchmark pricing system underpinning global sales of mined copper ores to protect the profitability of smelters, the company’s top commercial executive said in an interview.】

item.title: 加密货币跌势加深，以太币有陷入熊市的风险
item.description: 就在两个月前，围绕以太坊（Ethereum —区块链）的热情还在向主流市场蔓延。以太坊的原生代币以太币（Ether）飙升至四年来的最高点，因为投资者既将其视为一种货币，也将其视为对以太坊在支付和金融领域日益重要作用的押注。华尔街的交易员们正在围绕以太坊构建基金，而环球银行金融电信协会（SWIFT）与以太坊挂钩的分类账试点似乎也证实了以太坊作为现实世界基础设施的到来。【原文：Just two months ago, enthusiasm around Ethereum — the blockchain that powers a key corner of the crypto economy — was spilling into the mainstream. Its native token, Ether, had surged to a four-year high as investors treated it as both a currency and a bet on the network’s growing role in payments and finance. Wall Street desks were structuring funds around it, and SWIFT’s pilot of an Ethereum-linked ledger seemed to confirm its arrival as real-world infrastructure.】

item.title: 意大利将削减中产阶级所得税，耗资 90 亿欧元
item.description: 意大利最新的预算案将减轻中产阶级收入者的负担，使总理乔治亚-梅洛尼（Giorgia Meloni）能够在三年内花费约 90 亿欧元（105 亿美元）兑现她对选民的承诺。【原文：Italy’s latest budget will ease the burden on middle-class earners, allowing Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni to keep her promise to voters at a cost of about €9 billion ($10.5 billion) over three years.】

item.title: 西方石油公司首席执行官霍鲁布认为 2026 年前油价区间紧张
item.description: 西方石油公司（Occidental Petroleum Corp.首席执行官维基-霍鲁布（Vicki Hollub）周二在伦敦能源情报论坛上说，她认为到2026年，石油价格将在每桶58美元至62美元之间。【原文：Occidental Petroleum Corp. Chief Executive Officer Vicki Hollub sees oil pricing between $58 and $62 a barrel through 2026, she said Tuesday at the Energy Intelligence Forum in London.】

item.title: 维勒鲁瓦称法国需要 "大幅 "削减赤字
item.description: 法国央行行长表示，法国必须大幅削减开支，以帮助减少预算缺口，而预算缺口正在加剧政治动荡，并使债券市场岌岌可危。【原文：France must make major spending cuts to help bring down a budget shortfall that’s fueling political turmoil and rattling bond markets, its central-bank governor said.】

item.title: StubHub 分析师看好该股。市场尚未信服
item.description: StubHub Holdings Inc. 在上个月以 8 亿美元首次公开募股后，其股价能否从亏损中恢复过来，取决于该票务销售平台明年能否在销售额和利润率方面实现曲棍球棒般的增长。【原文：StubHub Holdings Inc.’s hopes of its stock recovering from its losses after last month’s $800 million initial public offering depend on the ticket-selling platform coming through with hockey stick-like increases in sales and profit margins next year.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长科切尔：在泡沫风险下不会过多放松管制
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员马丁-科切尔建议，鉴于市场背景，目前不要采取过于激烈的行动来放松银行监管。【原文：European Central Bank Governing Council member Martin Kocher advised against too drastic a move to loosen bank regulation at present, given the market backdrop.】

item.title: 鲍威尔称美联储未来数月可能停止缩减资产负债表
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）表示，央行可能在未来几个月内停止缩减资产负债表。【原文：Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell signaled the central bank may stop shrinking its balance sheet in the coming months.】

item.title: 维勒鲁瓦称欧洲央行下一步行动更可能是减息而非加息
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员弗朗索瓦-维勒鲁瓦-德-加尔豪（Francois Villeroy de Galhau）表示，欧洲中央银行下一步更有可能降低利率，而不是提高利率。【原文：The European Central Bank is more likely to lower interest rates than raise them as its next move, according to Governing Council member Francois Villeroy de Galhau.】

item.title: 大豆保持在 10 美元附近，美国出货量创 2 月份以来之最
item.description: 大豆期货跌至盘中低点附近，此前的数据显示，美国大豆装运量创下 2 月份以来的新高，尽管第一大市场中国依然缺席。【原文：Soybean futures fell near session lows after data showed US shipments at the highest since February even as top market China remained absent.】

item.title: 石油交易巨头称市场期待已久的盈余即将到来
item.description: 一些世界顶级大宗商品交易商说，人们期待已久的石油过剩终于开始出现，并有可能压低价格。【原文：A long-anticipated oil surplus is finally starting to emerge and is likely to depress prices, some of the world’s top commodity traders said.】

item.title: 路威酩轩集团恢复增长，时尚部门表现坚挺
item.description: 由于购物者在酩悦香槟和迪奥香水上大肆挥霍，LVMH 集团第三季度的销售额出人意料地恢复了增长，这表明奢侈品需求的持续低迷正在缓解。【原文：LVMH sales unexpectedly returned to growth in the third quarter as shoppers splurged on Moët & Chandon Champagne and Dior perfumes, suggesting a persistent slump in luxury demand is easing.】

item.title: Makhlouf 称，通货紧缩已经结束，欧洲央行形势大好
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员加布里埃尔-马赫卢夫（Gabriel Makhlouf）表示，欧洲中央银行的利率仍然处于 "良好的位置"，通胀率已回到目标水平，经济在应对国内外挑战时表现良好。【原文：European Central Bank interest rates remain in a “good place” with inflation back at target and the economy holding up well against challenges from within the region and abroad, according to Governing Council member Gabriel Makhlouf.】

item.title: 阿美石油公司贸易部进军金属业，计划招聘铜管工
item.description: 沙特阿美石油公司（Saudi Aramco）的贸易部门计划招聘铜交易员，作为进军金属市场的一部分，加入能源巨头进军该领域的浪潮。【原文：The trading arm of Saudi Aramco plans to hire copper traders as part of a push into metals markets, joining a growing wave of energy giants moving into the sector.】

item.title: 美联储鲍威尔将在 NABE 会议上发表讲话
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔摄影：Kent Nishimura/Bloomberg【原文：Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell Photographer: Kent Nishimura/Bloomberg】

item.title: 微软将在葡萄牙租用 Nscale 人工智能数据中心容量
item.description: 微软公司将在葡萄牙的一个数据中心租用 Nscale 的容量，这家美国科技公司将扩大其计算资源，以满足人工智能日益增长的需求。【原文：Microsoft Corp. will rent capacity from Nscale at a data center in Portugal, as the US tech company expands its computing resources to meet growing demand for artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 亿万富翁保罗-都铎-琼斯预计纳斯达克指数年底将走高
item.description: 亿万富翁保罗-都铎-琼斯（Paul Tudor Jones）预计，由于交易商预期未来利率会降低，纳斯达克指数将在年底前攀升。【原文：Billionaire Paul Tudor Jones expects the Nasdaq to climb higher by the end of the year as traders anticipate lower interest rates ahead.】

item.title: 芝加哥亿万富翁伊什比亚为新私募股权投资基金融资 8.5 亿美元
item.description: 由亿万富翁贾斯汀-伊什比亚（Justin Ishbia）创建的芝加哥私募股权公司 Shore Capital Partners 为两只新基金筹集了 8.5 亿美元，这两只基金将投资于医疗保健领域，并支持企业家收购和管理公司。【原文：Shore Capital Partners, a Chicago private equity firm founded by billionaire Justin Ishbia, raised $850 million for two new funds that will invest in health care and back entrepreneurs looking to acquire and manage companies.】

item.title: 钻石依赖公司权衡 270 亿美元多元化计划
item.description: 博茨瓦纳立法者开始就一项 3880 亿普拉（约合 270 亿美元）的计划展开辩论，该计划旨在实现经济多样化，减少对钻石开采的依赖。【原文：Botswana lawmakers began debating a 388 billion-pula ($27 billion) plan to diversify the economy and reduce its dependence on diamond mining.】

item.title: 看跌天气前景预示需求疲软，美国天然气下滑
item.description: 美国天然气期货跌至两周多来的最低点，原因是10月下旬的温和天气预报显示取暖燃料需求不旺，而国内充足的库存也对市场构成了压力。【原文：US natural gas futures dropped to the lowest in more than two weeks as forecasts for mild weather through late October indicated tepid demand for the heating fuel, with ample domestic stockpiles also weighing on the market.】

item.title: 预算案乐观，法国债券风险降至四周低点
item.description: 法国总理塞巴斯蒂安-勒科努表示，他将提议暂停养老金改革，以推动预算案的通过，法国债券随之上涨，与更安全的德国同类债券的利差缩小到四周低点。【原文：French bonds rose, narrowing the spread over safer German counterparts to a four-week low, after Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu said he would propose suspending pension reform in an attempt to push through a budget.】

item.title: 拉加德说她不能宣布欧洲央行降息结束
item.description: 欧洲中央银行行长克里斯蒂娜-拉加德（Christine Lagarde）表示，尽管她重申货币政策和经济 "形势良好"，但她无法宣布降息结束。【原文：European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde said she can’t declare an end to interest-rate cuts, despite her reiterating that monetary policy and the economy are “in a good place.”】

item.title: 也许 "贬低 "不是最好的说法
item.description: 大家好，欢迎阅读《奇点》时事通讯，它是来自《奇点》世界的每日内容。有时是我们乔-韦森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）为您带来我们对市场、金融和经济最新发展的看法。有时是我们的专家嘉宾和消息来源网络提供的内容。不管是什么，我们保证永远有趣。【原文：Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. Sometimes it's us, Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway, bringing you our thoughts on the most recent developments in markets, finance and the economy. And sometimes it's contributions from our network of expert guests and sources. Whatever it is, we promise it will always be interesting.】

item.title: 马拉维排除因外汇流入导致货币贬值的可能性
item.description: 马拉维中央银行排除了货币贬值的必要性，因为在选民选出新总统后，外汇流入增加，缓解了美元短缺的问题。【原文：Malawi’s central bank ruled out the need to devalue the currency because foreign-exchange inflows increased after voters elected a new president, easing a dollar shortage.】

item.title: BTG Pactual 提出收购要约后，Banco Pan 跳升幅度创 2020 年以来之最
item.description: 在 Banco BTG Pactual SA 宣布出价收购该金融机构尚未持有的剩余股份后，Banco Pan SA 的股价创下五年来最大涨幅。【原文：Banco Pan SA surged the most in five years after Banco BTG Pactual SA announced a bid to acquire the remaining shares that it doesn’t already own in the financial institution.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织称，全球贷款人面临非银行压力带来的资本冲击风险
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）周二警告说，如果对冲基金和另类资产管理公司等全球金融体系的其他部分出现裂痕，银行的资本可能会遭受 "重大 "打击。【原文：Banks could suffer a “significant” hit to their capital if cracks appear in other parts of the global financial system such as hedge funds and alternative asset managers, the International Monetary Fund warned on Tuesday.】
